content.text:
# List of French non-presidential heads of state by tenure__disambig_1

This is a list of the Republican French heads of state who have not held the title "President of the Republic" since the final fall of House of Capet in 1848, as sorted by length of service.
List
{| class="wikitable" style="width:90%; text-align:center;"
|-
! colspan="1" width=70|Portrait
! colspan="1" width=28%|Name(Birth–Death)
! colspan="1" width=28%|Title
! colspan="2" width=36%|Term of office
! width=30%|Political Party(Political Coalition)
|-
|
| Philippe Pétain(1856–1951)
|Chief of State
| 11 July 1940
| 19 August 1944
| Independent
|-
|
| Charles de Gaulle(1890–1970)
| Chairman of the Provisional Government
| 20 August 1944
| 26 January 1946
| Independent

| Louis-Eugène Cavaignac(1802–1857)
| Chief of the Executive Power
| 28 June 1848
| 20 December 1848
| Republican
|-

| Jacques-Charles Dupont de l'Eure(1767–1855)
| Chairman of the Provisional Government
| 26 February 1848
| 9 May 1848
| Moderate Republican
|-

| Félix Gouin(1884–1977)
| Chairman of the Provisional Government

| 24 June 1946
| French Section of the Workers' International(Tripartisme)

| Popular Republican Movement(Tripartisme)

| Louis-Jules Trochu(1815–1896)

|

| François Arago(1786–1853)
| Chairman of the Executive Commission

| Moderate Republican
|-
|
| Vincent Auriol(1884–1966)(interim)
| President of the French Fourth Republic
| 28 November 1946
| 16 December 1946
| French Section of the Workers' International(Tripartisme)
|}
